A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her progress, various sorts of turmoil in her D.I.Y life lead to an abortive entry in the race, then a genuine entry, but with an unknown and untested horse and an untried groom. Other performers include Ron Moody , Patrick Davies, and Oliver Milburn.

This is probably the only female Ninja movie ever made. It's great as a B film and the action sequences are a lot of fun to watch. This is a well done crowdfunded film made by director Chris Ward that stars Abigail Zukowski as Jaclyn Smith who is the Ninja in question. As a sex symbol, Ms. Zukowski would make an excellent female Ninja but most of the action is performed by stunt people who are really hard to keep track of.

I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of the competition between the kids, and the family tradition and background they shared. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century.
